title: India Aces Crew Capsule Abort Test
summary: India successfully completed a high altitude crew capsule abort test for its nascent Gaganyaan human spaceflight program today. The first attempt scrubbed just before liftoff, but they quickly found and […]

title: India tests launch escape system in step towards sending astronauts to orbit
summary: India took a step towards independent human spaceflight capabilities early Saturday with a successful uncrewed emergency escape system test.

title: RFA, ATMOS, and Yuri Announce “Eva” Microgravity Service
summary:
German space companies Rocket Factory Augsburg, Yuri, and ATMOS Space Cargo have announced a new partnership to launch an end-to-end service for microgravity research. The three companies’ new “Eva” microgravity research service was presented at the 2023 edition of Weltraumkongress (Space Congress) in Berlin, Germany. RFA will be responsible for the service’s low-cost launch services. […]
The post RFA, ATMOS, and Yuri Announce “Eva” Microgravity Service appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA Upbeat About Future of Mars Sample Return Despite IRB-2 Report
summary: NASA may have received discouraging news from a recent independent review of the Mars Sample Return mission, but key NASA officials and members of the space science community remain upbeat […]

title: Upgraded star trackers could give more satellites a debris-monitoring role
summary: New star-tracking sensors in the works would enable all manner of satellites to keep an eye out for hazardous orbital debris too small to detect from the ground.

title: ISS Roundup: Expedition 70 underway, Rubio’s record stay in space, technical issues, upcoming EVAs
summary: The last few months aboard the International Space Station (ISS) have been eventful. Expedition 70 is underway after two crew handovers, a bearing on a solar array rotary joint seized up, and a coolant leak on the Russian segment occurred. Currently, the ISS crew is preparing for Russian EVA-61 and US EVA-89 later this month.

title: PLD Space calls first launch a success
summary: Spanish launch vehicle startup PLD Space declared their first suborbital launch a success, clearing the way for development of an orbital launch vehicle.

title: Space Development Agency awards York Space $615 million contract for 62 satellites
summary: The Space Development Agency has awarded York Space a $615 million contract for 62 satellites for DoD’s low Earth orbit constellation.

title: Pakistan becomes latest country to join China’s ILRS moon project
summary: Pakistan officially joined China’s International Lunar Research Station, the China National Space Administration announced Friday.

title: Canada’s budget boost for Radarsat is part of its climate strategy
summary: Canada’s newly announced plan to invest 1 billion Canadian dollars ($739 million)  over the next 15 years in the Radarsat mission is part of the federal government’s climate resilience strategy. […]
